column4: Ubuntu really needs a distinct walkthrough of everything important. Like a help file pointing out all the different options in the sound section. Specifically why there are 1000000000000000 options in the drop down menus.
and each option in those drop down menus makes different sounds come out of different speakers
well theres man pages for that, granted they're kinda hard to understand at times, but they're there.
type man find in a terminal
you may be the most awesome guy ever
when I go to synaptic manager, there are like 100 things to do with pulse, do I install them all?
hmm i would just install pulseaudio, that other stuff listed there are just extras i beleive, at any rate, once you choose pulseaudio, it will pull in everything else it needs anyways
thanks I appreciate it, I'll give it ago... I'm also having a problem getting sound with flash
'sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras'  *MIGHT* work for that flash sound issue, im not a flash guru really, but try that.
what is this downloading? seems like a lot of stuff :D
various codecs and what not needed to for flash, mp3, dvd stuff
lol I'm still kinda new at this myself but I've learned a few basics in this channel to be able to help you with those questions you had :)
man it didn't work, but my sound settings may not be right in the generic section. Do you mind if I pm and pick your brain on basic sound stuff?
im not a sound guy, so i prolly wouldnt be much help sorry
